## Summary
- Rule available since: `v1.9.4`
- Diagnostic Category: [`lint/nursery/noDocumentCookie`](/reference/diagnostics#diagnostic-category)
- This rule doesn't have a fix.
- The default severity of this rule is [**information**](/reference/diagnostics#information).
- Sources: 
  - Same as [`unicorn/no-document-cookie`](https://github.com/sindresorhus/eslint-plugin-unicorn/blob/main/docs/rules/no-document-cookie.md)

:::caution
This rule is part of the [nursery](/linter/rules/#nursery) group.
:::
## Description
Disallow direct assignments to `document.cookie`.

It's not recommended to use document.cookie directly as it's easy to get the string wrong.
Instead, you should use the [Cookie Store API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CookieStore).

## Examples

### Invalid

```js
document.cookie = "foo=bar";
```

### Valid

```js
const array = document.cookie.split("; ");
```

```js
await cookieStore
  .set({
    name: "foo",
    value: "bar",
    expires: Date.now() + 24 * 60 * 60,
    domain: "example.com",
})
```

```js
import Cookies from 'js-cookie';

Cookies.set('foo', 'bar');
```

## How to configure
```json title="biome.json"
{
	"linter": {
		"rules": {
			"nursery": {
				"noDocumentCookie": "error"
			}
		}
	}
}

```
